tachyon.util.io

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.util.io.FileUtils

  • public final class FileUtils
extends Object
    Provides utility methods for working with files and directories. By convention, methods take file path strings as parameters.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • changeLocalFilePermission

        public static void changeLocalFilePermission(String filePath,
                                             String perms)
                                      throws IOException
        Changes local file's permission.
        Parameters:
        filePath - that will change permission
        perms - the permission, e.g. "775"
        Throws:
        IOException - when fails to change permission

      • changeLocalFileToFullPermission

        public static void changeLocalFileToFullPermission(String filePath)
                                            throws IOException
        Changes local file's permission to be 777.
        Parameters:
        filePath - that will change permission
        Throws:
        IOException - when fails to change file's permission to 777

      • setLocalDirStickyBit

        public static void setLocalDirStickyBit(String dir)
        Sticky bit can be set primarily on directories in UNIX / Linux. If the sticky bit of is enabled on a directory, only the owner and the root user can delete / rename the files or directories within that directory. No one else can delete other users data in this directory(Where sticky bit is set). This is a security measure to avoid deletion of folders and their content (sub-folders and files), though other users have full permissions. Setting the sticky bit of a file is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        dir - absolute dir path to set the sticky bit

      • createBlockPath

        public static void createBlockPath(String path)
                            throws IOException
        Creates the local block path and all the parent directories. Also, sets the appropriate permissions.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the block
        Throws:
        IOException - when fails to create block path and parent directories with appropriate permissions.

      • move

        public static void move(String srcPath,
                        String dstPath)
                 throws IOException
        Moves file from one place to another, can across storage devices (e.g., from memory to SSD) when File.renameTo(java.io.File) may not work. Current implementation uses Files.move(File, File), may change if there is a better solution.
        Parameters:
        srcPath - pathname string of source file
        dstPath - pathname string of destination file
        Throws:
        IOException - when fails to move

      • delete

        public static void delete(String path)
                   throws IOException
        Deletes the file or directory. Current implementation uses File.delete(), may change if there is a better solution.
        Parameters:
        path - pathname string of file or directory
        Throws:
        IOException - when fails to delete

      • createStorageDirPath

        public static void createStorageDirPath(String path)
                                 throws IOException
        Creates the storage directory path, including any necessary but nonexistent parent directories. If the directory already exists, do nothing. Also, appropriate directory permissions (777 + StickyBit, namely "drwxrwxrwt") are set.
        Parameters:
        path - storage directory path to create
        Throws:
        IOException - when fails to create storage directory path

      • createFile

        public static void createFile(String filePath)
                       throws IOException
        Creates an empty file and its intermediate directories if necessary.
        Parameters:
        filePath - pathname string of the file to create
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurred or file already exists

      • createDir

        public static void createDir(String path)
                      throws IOException
        Creates an empty directory and its intermediate directories if necessary.
        Parameters:
        path - path of the directory to create
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurred or directory already exists

      • exists

        public static boolean exists(String path)
        Checks if a path exists.
        Parameters:
        path - the given path
        Returns:
        true if path exists, false otherwise
